The claim made by Mike Pence: the Republican vice presidential nominee, that Americans are paying higher taxes under President Barack Obama.
The list of tax hikes enacted under Obam: Pence's campaign spokesman, which includes a levy on tobacco products and taxes raised to fund the president's health care reforms.
The confirmation from Roberton Williams: a fellow at the nonpartisan Urban-Brookings Tax Policy Center, that there haven't been many major tax changes during Obama's term, but he pointed out two changes to tax laws.
The average federal tax burden on househ: which increased from 17.3 percent in 2009 to 20.1 percent in 2013, according to a report issued by the nonpartisan Congressional Budget Office.
